Literature Review: The localization of plasticity in metallic materials is a complex phenomenon that has garnered significant attention in recent years due to its profound impact on the mechanical properties of these materials. Advanced experimental and numerical approaches have been developed to capture the localization of plasticity at the nanometer scale, enabling a deeper understanding of the mechanisms and mechanics involved. This review aims to provide an overview of emerging approaches, focusing on the localization of plasticity by crystallographic slip, and to discuss the consequences of this phenomenon for the mechanical properties of metallic materials.
